TextView.android:text: Cashierbook Mobile Commerce App’s Products and Service Terms and Conditions

Cashierbook is a mobile commerce app company situated at TARC Incubator at Tunku Abdul Rahman University College (TAR UC). Cashierbook promotes mobile commerce services for Wangsa Walk Mall (WWM) tenants to the TAR UC communities (are referred to as buyers). Cashierbook company fully owns the intellectual property rights of the Cashierbook system. This letter is to notify the sellers on the Cashierbook Mobile Commerce App’s Product and Service Terms and Conditions, charges and rates that incur to the sellers (are referred to as Wangsa Walk Mall (WWM) tenants or retailers) as sellers register with the Cashierbook. One of the key strengths of Cashierbook system is its integrated data privacy mechanism and most trusted and secured iPay88 payment gateway from iPay88 (M) Sdn Bhd to ensure buyers’ and sellers’ (WWM retailers in this context) payment information to the highest level.
Cashierbook Mobile Commerce App’s Products and Service Terms and Conditions

1. On the Cashierbook Mobile Commerce’s payment management, all buyers can pay their purchases using either bank transfer, PayPal, credit card or debit card through iPay88 payment gateway service. Sellers will absorb the online payment transaction charge of 1% for every transaction’s amount. This is the transaction processing charges imposed by iPay88. 

 2. The item’s drop off point at Wangsa Walk Mall is determined by MCL Land (Malaysia) Sdn. Bhd. When the purchased item reach TAR UC, the item’s drop off point at Canteen 2 (Yum Yum Cafeteria). At the beginning of the project, we will schedule one trip per day at 4pm leaving from Wangsa Walk Mall to reach at TAR UC about 4:15pm. Delivery schedule will be revised from time to time based on the transaction volume and needs. 

 3. Payment settlement turnaround time from iPay88 to the sellers will be on the following Friday of the week or on a 10-day turn-around time according to iPay88 payment settlement Standard Operating Procedure (SOP). E.g. The payment from the buyers to the sellers for this Monday until Friday will be settled to the sellers’ bank account by next Friday. 

 4. The sellers of Cashierbook system are solely responsible for any actions that they performed on the Cashierbook system according to the Malaysian law. Cashierbook company will not be liable for any illegal activities performed by the sellers in the Cashierbook system. 

 5. For items listed in the Cashierbook system, when buyer make a purchase of the listed item, Cashierbook company will charge an administration fee of 1% of the total listed price posted by the sellers. On the delivery services, a delivery charge of RM3 per item will be imposed on the buyers. 

 6. All items’ size is limit to no more than “A4” size and should be weight less than 2kg. Any items that are more than “A4” and weight more than 2kg will be charged on a case-to-case basis for the transporting fee. Sellers are required to indicate on the Cashierbook Mobile App.

7. In case of buyer wants to return any items to the item’s sellers, buyer need to return the purchased items to the respective seller’s physical shop at WWM by themselves without going through Cashierbook system. Cashierbook system will not process any transaction and activity related to the return item event. 

 8. Cashierbook company reserved the right to ban the sellers or remove any items posted by the sellers at any given time without further reference to the WWM tenants and buyers if the sellers are found to have violated regulations of WWM and Laws of Malaysia. 

 9. Cashierbook company reserved the right to reject any item(s) in the buyer’s order if the sellers cannot deliver the buyer’s requested item(s) to the WWM’s Cashierbook item collection (pick-up) counter within the time frame that specified by the Cashierbook system. 

 10. Cashierbook company reserved the rights to review and change the mentioned terms and conditions in this letter at any given time and conditions without further reference to the WWM tenants and buyers. 

 11. Retailer need to reply confirmation of availability of stock and item to pack for delivery within the day of order through the Cashierbook system. 

 12. If buyer had made his or her payment after purchased item at Cashierbook system and then WWM tenants cancel order due to any reason. Hence, WWM tenants will absorb the transaction fee lost occurred from the buyer’s transaction. 

 13. WWM tenants needs to provide complete and correct company information such as company registration from Suruhanjaya Syarikat Malaysia (SSM), company’s bank account and other relevant information to Cashierbook company for merchant registration. 

 14. WWM tenants and buyers agreed to authorize WWM management and Cashierbook company to view and use the data from Cashierbook system. 

 Cashierbook team looks forward to work together with you to bring your business’s sales performance to the next level with Cashierbook’s services.
